oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery's Interview of Kris Kristofferson - 1980-02-26: Reel # 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Ralph Emery (entertainer) interviewing Kris Kristofferson (musician) for the Ralph Emery Show. The interview takes place on February 26, 1980. The tape is part one of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kris Kristofferson; Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) Kris Kristofferson performs a radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:14) Kristofferson reflects on the hardest part of performing a radio spot -- (00:32) Ralph Emery introduces Kristofferson and the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:50) Kristofferson and Emery reflect on the difficulty of saying Kristofferson and Kristofferson's upcoming Hank Williams tribute -- (02:55) Emery asks who the inspiration for "Me and Bobby McGee" was -- (04:33) Emery recalls how Kristofferson would fly helicopters to the Gulf of Mexico -- (06:20) Kristofferson reflects on what Barbra Streisand is like -- (10:02) Emery recalls discussing Frank Sinatra with Kristofferson, and both associate this to "Help Me Make it Through the Night" -- (11:15) Emery and Kristofferson reflect on how Gene Nash was the first to record "Help Me Make it Through the Night" -- (13:27) Emery and Kristofferson reflect on how Kristofferson lives in Malibu, California -- (14:37) Kristofferson reveals he is about to divorce Rita Coolidge while discussing how they met -- (16:30) Emery invites Kristofferson to reflect on how he worked as a handy-man at the Columbia Records studio; additionally, Kristofferson's military influence is discussed -- (20:57) Kristofferson is invited to reflect on the term 'hillbilly' being associated to Nashville, Tennessee -- (22:28) Emery inquires as to where in Texas Kristofferson grew up; additionally, Emery praises Kristofferson and asks him to reflect on being a 'road scholar' -- (26:18) Emery inquires about Kristofferson's transition to the army and Nashville, Tennessee -- (29:15) Kristofferson reflects on how flew a song to Johnny Cash -- (31:07) Emery recalls how Kristofferson used to live next to 'Record Row' -- (33:21) Emery and Kristofferson discuss Kristofferson's work at the Tally Ho Tavern -- (35:42) Emery asks Kristofferson to reflect on what caused him to leave Nashville, Tennessee -- (37:16) Emery inquires to Kristofferson's initial impressions on recording; additionally, Kristofferson's two marriages are discussed -- (40:52) Emery recalls having the opportunity to record one of Kristofferson's songs -- (41:55) Emery explains how Willie Nelson recently did a homage to Kristofferson, and Kristofferson reflects on how performing in movies changed people's perception of him -- (44:46) Emery inquires about Kristofferson's typical schedule -- (46:28) Emery asks Kristofferson to reflect on the differences between Hollywood, California and Nashville, Tennessee -- (48:55) Kristofferson reflects on having multiple broken bones while recording -- (49:15) Kristofferson discusses how, in A Star is Born, he messed up love scene; additionally, Kristofferson recalls how manure was being put on Barbra Streisand -- (53:54) Streisand's temper is touched on by Kristofferson; additionally, Emery inquires about the story of A Star is Born -- (55:42) Emery asks Kristofferson who he would like to film with; additionally, Nelson's film work is discussed -- (58:36) Emery inquires as to how Kristofferson deals with large groups of fans and going to restaurants -- (1:02:24) Kristofferson discusses why he tries to sign autographs -- (1:02:59) Kristofferson expresses how he was a fan of Ernest Tubb, and Emery Kristofferson reflect on Kristofferson's growing success -- (1:04:41) Emery and Kristofferson recall Kristofferson's first interview with Emery, and Emery sites that people believe Kristofferson is attractive
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: The insert time stamps Emery's interview with Kristofferson.
